chapter.pericope: Judgment of Jerusalem and the Nations

ul.li1: 1Woe to you, O rebellious and defiled one!
ul.li2: The oppressing city!
ul.li1: 2She listens to no voice;
ul.li2: she does not accept correction.
ul.li1: In Yahweh she does not trust;
ul.li2: to her God she does not draw near.
ul.li1: 3Her officials in her midst are roaring lions;
ul.li2: her judges are evening wolves;
ul.li3: they leave nothing until the morning.
ul.li1: 4Her prophets are arrogant men of treachery;
ul.li2: her priests have defiled that which is holy;
ul.li3: they do violence to the law.
ul.li1: 5Yahweh is righteous in her midst;
ul.li2: he does not do wickedness.
ul.li1: Morning by morningLiterally “In the morning, in the morning” he renders his judgment;
ul.li2: at dawn he does not fail,
ul.li1: but an evil one knows no shame.
6“I have cut off nations;
ul.li2: their strongholds are deserted.
ul.li1: I have laid waste their streets,
ul.li2: so that none pass through.
ul.li1: Their cities have been destroyed
ul.li2: and are without a man, without an inhabitant.
ul.li1: 7I have said, ‘Surely she will fear me;
ul.li2: she will accept discipline.
ul.li1: Then her dwelling place will not be cut down,
ul.li2: nor all that I have brought upon her.’
ul.li1: Surely they rise early;
ul.li2: they make all their deeds corrupt.
ul.li1: 8“Therefore, wait for me”—a declaration of Yahweh—
ul.li2: “for the day of my rising as a witness.
ul.li1: For my decision is to gather nations,
ul.li2: to assembleThe traditional Hebrew has “assemble me”; this translation follows LXX kingdoms,
to pour out my wrath upon them, all my burning anger.
ul.li1: For by the fire of my anger all the land shall be consumed.
9Because then I will make the speech of the nations pure;Literally “I will turn to the nations a purged lip”
ul.li2: that all of them might call on the name of Yahweh,
to serve him in unison.Literally “with one shoulder”
ul.li1: 10From beyond the rivers of Cush
ul.li2: my worshipers and the daughter of my scattered ones
shall bring my offering.
ul.li1: 11On that day you shall not be humiliated
ul.li2: on account of all your deeds
by which you have rebelled against me.
ul.li1: For then I shall remove from your midst
ul.li2: those exulting in your pride,
ul.li1: and you shall no longer be haughty
ul.li2: in my holy mountain.Literally “the mountain of my holiness”
ul.li1: 12And I will leave in your midst
ul.li2: a people afflicted and poor,
ul.li1: and they shall take refuge
ul.li2: in the name of Yahweh.
ul.li1: 13The remnant of Israel
ul.li2: shall not do wickedness;
ul.li1: they shall not speak deception,
ul.li2: nor shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth.
ul.li1: For they shall graze and lie down,
ul.li2: and none shall frighten them.”
ul.li1: 14Shout for joy, O daughter of Zion!
ul.li2: Cry aloud, O Israel!
ul.li1: Rejoice and be jubilant with all your heart,
ul.li2: O daughter of Jerusalem!
ul.li1: 15Yahweh has annulled your judgments;
ul.li2: he has turned away your enemies.
ul.li1: The king of Israel, Yahweh, is in your midst;
ul.li2: you shall no longer fear misfortune.
ul.li1: 16On that day it shall be said to Jerusalem,
ul.li2: “Fear not, O Zion;
your hands shall not hang limp.
ul.li1: 17Yahweh your God is in your midst;
ul.li2: a mighty warrior who saves.
ul.li1: He shall rejoice over you with joy;
ul.li2: he renewsThe translation follows the LXX text; the traditional Hebrew text reads “he will silence you in his love” you in his love;
he will exult over you with singing.
ul.li1: 18I will gather those of you grieving on account of the feast;
ul.li2: they were raising against her a reproach.
ul.li1: 19Behold, at that time I will deal with all your oppressors;
ul.li2: I will save the lame and gather the outcast.
ul.li1: I will changeOr “make” them from shame
ul.li2: to glory and renownLiterally “a name” throughout the whole world.
ul.li1: 20At that time I will bring you in;
ul.li2: at the time of my gathering you together.
ul.li1: For I will make you renownedLiterally “a name” and praised
ul.li2: among all the nations of the earth
ul.li1: when I restore your fortunes before your eyes,”
ul.li2: says Yahweh.
